item.title: PerfAction JMeter
item.description: This GitHub Action helps to automate performance testing using Apache JMeter and its plugins.

item.title: LoadRunner Exercises
item.description: These exercises were designed to learn LoadRunner by doing. This exercise series is a part of Performance Testing Trilogy üî∫.

item.title: Linux Docker LoadRunnerDeveloper
item.description: This docker image helps you to run LoadRunner Developer scripts in Linux container. LoadRunner Developer leverages DevWeb protocol, a brand new offering from Micro Focus.

item.title: Windows Docker WebTours
item.description: This docker file helps you to run Web Tours application in Windows container. Web Tours is the sample application to learn Micro Focus LoadRunner Professional.

item.title: Docker Netling
item.description:
üôã‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è What is Netling?

Netling is a load tester client for easy web testing. It is extremely fast while using little CPU or memory. It is an open source project. Developed by Tore Lervik.

item.title: JMeter Streamlit
item.description: Apache JMeter is an open source load testing tool written in 100% pure Java. JMeter supports umpteen protocols including HTTP(S), FTP, SMTP, Web Services, JMS and much more. In JMeter, you can generate HTML results after you done with the execution or you can use Backend Listeners to monitor the runtime results.

item.title: Windows Docker JMeter Plugins
item.description: This repo helps you to run Apache JMeter in your Windows container. It uses the JMeter on Windows Server Core with OpenJDK. Windows Docker Container for Apache JMeter and Plugins

item.title: Docker JMeter Windows
item.description: This repo helps you to run Apache JMeter in your Windows container. It uses the JMeter on Windows Server Core with OpenJDK. Windows Docker for Apache JMeter

item.title: Windows Docker LoadRunner Developer
item.description: This docker image helps you to run LoadRunner Developer scripts in Windows container. LoadRunner Developer leverages DevWeb protocol, a brand new offering from Micro Focus.

item.title: Hello Performance
item.description: Hello, Performance! This website will list all my open source contributions. Thanks for stopping by.
